intro: Uragoga ikengaensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, nocturnal blooms that open at night and close during the day. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its aromatic fragrance. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while its stems are typically woody and branched. Uragoga ikengaensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
